column1: But enterococcus can cause an infection if it gets into the urinary tract, bloodstream, or skin wounds.
Vancomycin is the antibiotic that is often used to treat these infections.
Antibiotics are medicines that are used to kill bacteria.

VRE infections are more common in patients who: - Are in the hospital, especially if they are taking antibiotics for a long time - Are older - Have long-term illnesses or weak immune systems - Have been treated before with vancomycin, or other antibiotics for a long time - Have been in intensive care units (ICUs) - Have been in cancer or transplant units - Have had major surgery - Have catheters to drain urine or intravenous (IV) catheters that stay in for a long time
- Hospital staff and health care providers must wash with soap and water or an alcohol-based hand sanitizer before and after caring for every patient.
Often, other antibiotics besides vancomycin can be used to treat most VRE infections.
